meanings.definition: A person who takes something again.
meanings.sent1: The retakers of the cookies were eager for a second chance to enjoy them.
meanings.sent2: The teacher allowed retakers of the quiz to improve their scores.
meanings.sent3: The retakers of the dance floor kept stepping on each other's toes.
meanings.sent4: The retakers of the spotlight shone brighter the second time around.
meanings.sent5: The retakers of the treasure hunt were determined to find the hidden prize.

meanings.definition: Those who take a test or exam again.
meanings.sent1: The retakers of the exam studied hard to improve their grades.
meanings.sent2: The school offered support for retakers to succeed in their retake.
meanings.sent3: The retakers of the test formed a study group to prepare together.
meanings.sent4: The retakers of the challenge approached it with renewed determination.
meanings.sent5: The retakers of the race were determined to cross the finish line this time.
